fields.value: Massively Open Online Course for Educators (MOOC-Ed) network dataset

dsDescriptionValue.value:
The dataset provides detailed information on the communications taking place
between learners in two offerings of the Massively Open Online Course for Educators (MOOC-Eds) titled The Digital Learning Transition in K-12 Schools. The courses were offered to educators from the USA and abroad during the spring and fall of 2013. Though based on the same course, minor controlled variations were made to both MOOCs in terms of the course length, discussion prompts, and group size. The primary use of this dataset is to enable social network analyses (SNAs) of these communications. In particular, it allows modeling network mechanisms to better understand factors that facilitate or impede the exchange of information among educators, and includes relevant characteristics of the participants, such as their professional roles and their experience in education.

fields.value:
This context and purpose of the dataset is further described in:

Kellogg, S., & Edelmann, A. (2015). Massively Open Online Course for Educators (MOOC-Ed) network dataset. British Journal of Educational Technology. http://doi.org/10.1111/bjet.12312

files.description: This file entails the network edgelist for the DLT1 MOOC-Ed. Each row signifies an online communication (edge) with the corresponding “sender,” “receiver” and further attributes of the communication listed across the columns.
files.label: DLT1 Edgelist.csv

dataFile.description: This file entails the network edgelist for the DLT1 MOOC-Ed. Each row signifies an online communication (edge) with the corresponding “sender,” “receiver” and further attributes of the communication listed across the columns.

files.description: This node attribute file contains individual characteristics of participants (nodes) for the DLT1 MOOC-Ed.
files.label: DLT1 Nodes.csv

dataFile.description: This node attribute file contains individual characteristics of participants (nodes) for the DLT1 MOOC-Ed.
